results.title: Bataille du Rail
results.brief_description:
A reconstruction of the resistance work, including sabotage of the railway link between the Occupied and the Free Zones by French railmen during World War II. Clement brought the stark realism of his documentary shorts to bear on his first feature, a peaan to the courage of the railway workers, with the men themselves re-enacting their actual exploits. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide. Awards: Cannes Film Festival (1956): Best film, best director.

Credits: Director, Rene Clement ; writers, Rene Clement, Colette Audry ; photography, Henri Alekan ; music, Yves Baudrier.
Cast: Barnault, Clarieux, Daurand, Desagneux.

results.title: L'homme Qui Ment = the Man Who Lies
results.creator_credit: Alain Robbe-Grillet, Maurice Urbain and Samy Halfon
results.brief_description:
Boris Varissa arrives in a small Central European village, used as a haven by local Resitance fighters. He sweet talks his way into the good graces of a family in mourning after the deeath of their son Jean, a Resistance fighter. This avant garde feature leaves the viewer to decide if Boris is telling the truth or covering up for his deeds leading to the death of the heroic Resistance fighter. Awards: Berlin International Film Festival (1968): Best Male Performance for Jean-Louis Trintignant.

Credits: Producers, Maurice Urbain, Samy Halfon ; director, Alain Robbe-Grillet ; writer, Alain Robbe-Grillet ; photography, Igor Luther ; music, Michel Fano ; editor, Bob Wade.
Cast: Jean-Louis Trintignant, Sylvie Breal, Dominique Prado, Ivan Mistrik, Sylvia Turbova, Catherine Robbe-Grillet, Zuzana Kocurikova, Jozef Kroner, Julius Vasek.

results.title: L'amour Nu = Naked Love
results.creator_credit: Yannick Bellon, Adolphe Viezzi and Henri Lassa
results.brief_description:
Claire, a UNESCO interpreter, meets Simon, an oceanographer at an international conference. They fall in love and contemplate life together, but Claire finds a suspicious lump in her breast. After a few trips to the doctor, she finds out that she needs a mastectomy. Unable to announce the truth to her new boyfriend, she breaks off their relationship.

Credits: Producers, Henri Lassa, Adolphe Viezzi ; director, Yannick Bellon ; writers, Yannick Bellon, Francoise Prevost ; photography, Jean Charvein ; music, Richard de Bordeaux.
Cast: Marlene Jobert, Jean-Michel Folon, Zoriza Lozic, Georges Rouquier, Hyppolite Girardot.

results.title: Femmes de Personne = Nobody's Women
results.brief_description:
Isabelle, Adeline and Cecile work in a radiology practice. Disappointed by relationships with men, they content themselves with chance encounters. In this indulgent piece on mid-life crisis in the middle classe, the male characters are presented as a collection of irresponsible, self-centred creatures while women battle to come to term with the great decisions in life such as child bearing and rearing, with force booze and cigarettes for solace.

Credits: Producer, Alain Terzian ; director, Christopher Frank ; writer, Christopher Frank ; photography, Jean Tournier ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Marthe Keller, Jean-Louis Trintignant, Caroline Cellier, Fanny Cottencon, Philippe Leotard.

results.title: La Chambre
results.brief_description:
Pierre is happily married to Eve and lives a comfortable existence. One day, as he is scheduled for a business trip, Eve finds him prostrate in the bathroom. Little by little, Pierre seems to lose contact with reality, refusing to leave his room and conducting dialogues with an other woman.

Credits: Director, Michel Mitrani ; writers, Gerard Jarlot, Michel Mitrani ; photography, Ghislain Cloquet.
Cast: Michel Auclair, Mireille Perey, Jean-Roger Caussimon, Marc Heyrand, Andree Tainsy.

results.title: Mort D'un Guide = Death of a Guide
results.brief_description:
In July 1974, Michel Servoz, a mountain guide based in Chamonix and his trainee, Patric Falavier, are reported missing in the Massif des Drus. Merinchal, a journalist who had previously interviewed Servoz, decides to cover the search and rescue operation. When he reaches Chamonix, he realises that Servoz and Chevalier were not on an ordinary training run but were attempting to open a new way to the top of the Drus. This made for TV film details with a documentary precision the close knit community of moutain guides. It contains stunning rock climbing sequences.

Credits: Director, Jacques Ertaud ; writer, Henry Grange ; photography, Rene Vernardet, Louis Miaille, Georges Orset ; music, Francois de Roubaix.
Cast: Victor Lanoux, Pierre Rousseau, Georges Claisse, Jean Valmont.

results.title: Jaguar
results.brief_description:
Feature film by French film-maker Jean Rouch, filmed in West Africa, about three young men who leave their life of cattle herding in the arid savanna bordering the Sahara, and travel thousands of miles to Ghana (then the Gold Coast) and back again. Rouch uses non-actors who improvise their parts. ‘A brilliant example of the role which creative interpretation can play in ethnographic film-making’. (David MacDougall in Film Quarterly). Dedicated to Gerard Philipe.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Braunberger ; director, Jean Rouch ; music, Enos Amelolon, Tallou Mouzourane, Amisata Gaoudelize, Djenne Molo Kari, Yankori, Ama.
Cast: Damoure Zika, Lam Ibrahima Dia, Illo Gaoudel, Amadou Koffo.

results.title: Clerambard
results.brief_description:
Clerambard lives on the edge of poverty in an old castle. He ekes a living out of killing cats and dogs and exploiting his family. His life is turned updside down after reading ‘The life of St Fancis of Assissi’. The Saint even appears to help Clerambard go out into the world to preach the gospel and reveal his newfound love of animals.

Credits: Producers, Yves Robert, Alain Poire ; director, Yves Robert ; writers, Jean-Loup Dabadie, Yves Robert ; photography, Rene Mathelin ; music, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Philippe Noiret, Dany Carrel, Lise Delamare, Gerard Lartigau, Claude Pieplu, Roger Carel, Martine Sarcey.

results.title: fin du jour
results.creator_credit: Julien Duvivier, Filmsonar a Epinay and Regina Film
results.brief_description:
This comedy peeks in at the lives and relationships between elderly thespians living in an actors’ retirement home. The home is almost bankrupt and so the actors must support themselves. The residents include a faded sex symbol, an intellectual actor who kept a great distance between himself and the audience, and a depressed thespian who tries to conceal the fact that he was only an understudy.

Credits: Director, Julien Duvivier ; writers, Charles Spaak, Julien Duvivier ; photography, Christian Matras ; music, Maurice Jaubert ; art direction, Jacques Krauss.
Cast: Louis Jouvet, Michel Simon, Madeleine Ozeray, Victor Francen, Gabrielle Dorziat, Sylvie.

results.title: L'ironie du Sort = Irony of Chance
results.brief_description:
Set in Nantes, during the German Occupation, the film examines a series of events and shows what might have happened if one thing had gone differently in each instance. The main protagonists are two friends, Antoine and Jean, both in love with Marie-Anne, and both actively involved with the Resistance.

Credits: Producer, Christine Gouze-Renal ; director, Edouard Molinaro ; writers, Edouard Molinaro, Paul Guimard, Pierre Kast ; photography, Alain Levent ; music, Jose Berghams.
Cast: Claude Rich, Pierre Clementi, Marie-Helene Breillat, Jacques Spiesser, Jean Desailly
